<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Coil Spy](/Monsters.aspx?ID=800)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Some serpentfolk undergo intense ritual training and practice to improve their innate ability to disguise themselves. These serpentfolk often identify as members of a sinister society known as the Coils of [Ydersius](/Deities.aspx?ID=211), and the most devoted of their number seek out methods of reincarnating into new forms to even more efficiently infiltrate enemy societies. But before such agents take this extreme step, they must prove themselves as Coil spies. These serpentfolk train in methods of infiltrating other societies to such an extent that they might be capable of infiltrating a mammalian civilization for years. Though they're expected to work entirely toward the eventual triumph of their people, most Coil spies also find personal pursuits to keep them occupied in the shorter term. When Coil spies get caught, it's rarely due to a lack of pure skill, but rather to their arrogance or recklessness as they pursue their hedonistic desires.

</column>

<title level="2" right="Creature 4">[Coil Spy](/Monsters.aspx?ID=800)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="NE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=91" />
<trait label="Serpentfolk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=307" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 238 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Perception** +10; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [scent (imprecise) 30 feet](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33)

**Languages**
[Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Dwarven](/Languages.aspx?ID=3), [Gnomish](/Languages.aspx?ID=5), [Undercommon](/Languages.aspx?ID=11); [telepathy 100 feet](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +10, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +13, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +11, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +11, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +10, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +10, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +12, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) +12

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +2

**Dex** +4

**Con** +1

**Int** +4

**Wis** +2

**Cha** +5
</row>

**Items**
[Hand Crossbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=69) (20 bolts), [Hunting Spider Venom](/Equipment.aspx?ID=118) (2), [Shortsword](/Weapons.aspx?ID=43), [Thieves' Tools](/Equipment.aspx?ID=58)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 22 

**Fort** +9 

**Ref** +12 

**Will** +10 (+4 status vs. [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106))

+1 status to all saves vs. magic
</row>

**HP** 48

**Resistances**
poison 5

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
shortsword +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 1d6+5 piercing plus serpentfolk venom

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fangs +14 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179)),
**Damage** 1d6+5 piercing plus serpentfolk venom

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
hand crossbow +10 ([range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)),
**Damage** 1d6+3 piercing plus serpentfolk venom or [hunting spider venom](/Equipment.aspx?ID=118)

**Occult Innate Spells** DC 21
- **1st**
[Ventriloquism](/Spells.aspx?ID=356) (at will)
- **2nd**
[Mirror Image](/Spells.aspx?ID=197) (at will)
- **3rd**
[Illusory Disguise](/Spells.aspx?ID=159) (at will)
- **4th**
[Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=315)

**Deceptive Reposition** <actions string="Single Action" />  The Coil spy Strides up to half their Speed and attempts a [Feint](/Actions.aspx?ID=48), in either order.

**Maintain Disguise**   A Coil spy can maintain an ongoing illusory disguise as long as they are conscious without having to re-cast the spell; they need only Cast the Spell again to reassume their illusory disguise if they wish to change their appearance or if the active spell is dispelled. Coil spies typically seek privacy when they need to sleep, as an ongoing illusory disguise ends an hour after they fall [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38).

**Serpentfolk Venom**  ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** DC 19 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** 1d4 poison damage and [enfeebled 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13) (1 round); **Stage 2** 2d4 poison damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

**[Sneak Attack](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=34)**   The Coil spy's Strikes deal an extra 2d6 precision damage to [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) creatures.

</column>
